2.title: Episode #13.2
2.plot: In this Month's Commuter Connections we find out what's new at MTA's Transit Information Center. In honor of Black History Month, host Tawanda Carter interviews Burtram Dailey, one of the first African American Operators. Michael Walk tells us how the first phase of BNIP changes will affect riders.

3.title: Marc Wedge Yard and Women's History
3.plot: In this month's edition of Commuter Connection, Cheryl Crowell of Cultural Tourism DC helps you make the most out of MARC Weekend Service this Spring. Meet Jim Miller and Wane-Jang Lin from MTA's Office of Construction and Engineering in this months We Are Your MTA segment. We honor Women's History Month with an interview of Joyce Batty, MTA's longest service female employee. And finally, MARC's David Johnson gives us the skinny on the prize winning MARC Wedge Yard.

4.title: Episode #13.4
4.plot: Just in time for the O's Opening Day, Buddy Alves discusses MTA services to Camden Yards. Jeff Snyder gives us a look at the MTA Bus Tracker, and we review the new ENDUI app developed by MVA that helps prevent impaired driving. Finally we visit the MD Science Center, it's high on the must see list for family fun and we find out why.

5.title: Episode #13.5
5.plot: On this edition of Commuter Connections we look at MTA's Midway Park as part of the Kirk Division neighborhood beautification project. May is Bike to Work month, find out how to take you and your bike for a ride on MTA. We take a visit to Maryland's State Capitol, historic and fabulous Annapolis. Finally, all the Preakness excitement is coming your way and we show you how to go the easy way- MTA!

6.title: New CharmCard
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

7.title: State Fair and New Fares
7.plot: New fares, State Fair and Light Rail is on the verge of getting fairly cool new passenger amenities, once the refurbishment is complete. Enjoy the view.

8.title: Roadeo
8.plot: New MTA Administrator Paul Comfort shares his vision for the agency, MTA wins a national safety award, plus an opportunity to meet our latest Rail Rodeo Champions.

12.title: Episode #9.12
12.plot: MTA Mentor program allows experienced drivers to give a helping hand to our freshmen!

3.title: Episode #10.3
3.plot: Beverly Swaim-Staley, Maryland Secretary of Transportation, discusses the MDOT Veteran Resource Expo.

1.title: Weekend Launch
1.plot: The January 2014 edition of the Commuter Connections features , Baltimore Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake, Congressman Elijah Cummings and other Maryland officials for the launch of MARC weekend service. Also, segments or features on places to visit in Baltimore on MARC, Mobility and the Chimes of Maryland, groundbreaking ceremonies for the new Kirk Bus Division, a behind the scenes transit employee and our monthly Ask the MTA segment.

6.title: Summer Festivals
6.plot: On the June 2014 edition of Commuter Connections, Paulette Austrich introduces MTA's new Chief Operations Officer, Ronald Barnes. Summer brings two major festivals to the Baltimore area, African American Heritage and ArtScape - we have the scoop on this year's entertainment and activities. Finally, see our Words on Wheels winners and our monthly "Ask the MTA" question and answers.
